subject: Re: [junit] Testing Dates
msgSnippet: ... Without a test failure message, we can t possibly help you... unless you re creating two Date objects and they re different by a few milliseconds. -- J. B.
messageBody:
jyothi_bhogadi wrote:
>
>
> Hi,
>
> Iam trying to insert a date in to database by creating java.util.date
> ().
>
> After that iam trying to retrieve the same and compare both with
>
> asserequals()by taking .gettime().but assertr failure is cooming.
>
> Please help me to solve this problem

Without a test failure message, we can't possibly help you... unless
you're creating two Date objects and they're different by a few
milliseconds.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
